column4: I cant get my wireless linksys wusb54g working does anybody know maybe a website that would help me?
I cant get my wireless linksys wusb54g working does anybody know maybe a website that would help me?
here's the page http://ndiswrapper.sourceforge.net/mediawiki/index.php/Distributions
I configured that same card, let me find the website
thanks man you're a life saver
what is the website!
you're right, these instructions are old. Basically ndiswrapper lets you use the windows drivers from the cd on linux, and in this case it is the only way to make WUSB54G work
in the instructions they have sample driver names, but make sure you use the acutal driver name when you do it, like WUSB54G.inf or something
I install the driver using ndiswrapper -i drive.inf then ndiswrapper -l then I get driver invalid and that driver is the one that came with the adapter??
are you sure that is the only driver that came on the cd? I remember there being at least two.
my is v4 theres also v1 and v2 should I try to install them?
no, v4 is a different chipset than v1 and v2, so the other two won't work
I only copyed the .inf file when I installed
yes
then that's definitely the driver you should use. I had the same kind of problem with the invalid driver, but I finally got it to work somehow
the odd thing is that the first time I installed ubuntu i got my connection automatically now it just won't work!
that's pretty cool. I don't know how that happened, because I thought ndiswrapper was the only way to install that adapter
how do uninstall the driver so I can try to reinstall again?
I can't remember - try typing "man ndiswrapper" for a list of options
it says ndiswrapper -e driver.inf but it says driver not installed try ndiswrapper -l to see the list
dude this thing makes no f,, sence!
see what the list says. You might not be typing the name exactly the way it appears.
i got installed!
but still couldn't connect i'm rebooting now! to see what happens
